title: ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement tensorflow

labels.name: wontfix
labels.description: This will not be worked on

body:
```
Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.17134.1069]
(c) 2018 Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.
C:\Users\Rens van de Schoot>python --version
Python 3.8.0
C:\Users\Rens van de Schoot>pip install asreview
Collecting asreview
  Downloading https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/3c/6c/aacdd5dc76d625934b7e9671ce1016b19c2130caec60a0002966c1d11ff3/asreview-0.3.1-py3-none-any.whl (93kB)
     |████████████████████████████████| 102kB 3.3MB/s
Collecting PyInquirer (from asreview)
  Downloading https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/fb/4c/434b7c454010a284b49d6f1d446fe8dc5960415613d8c0225b9e2efb6724/PyInquirer-1.0.3.tar.gz
Collecting tensorflow (from asreview)
  ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement tensorflow (from asreview) (from versions: none)
ERROR: No matching distribution found for tensorflow (from asreview)
WARNING: You are using pip version 19.2.3, however version 19.3.1 is available.
You should consider upgrading via the 'python -m pip install --upgrade pip' command.
```

Tensorflow wheel isn't available for Python 3.8 at the moment. This is a problem on the side tensorflow. Please use Python 3.7 or compile tensorflow yourself (advanced).
